reviews.productTitle: Maxxima LED Slide Dimmer Rocker Switch - 3-Way/Single Pole Compatible, Decorative Electrical Light Switch, 600 Watt Max, LED Compatible for Indoor Home Use, Wall Plate Cover Included - Ivory
reviews.text: After I installed this switch, I discovered that the dimmer slider sticks on the left (low) side and it is difficult to get it to move right. I uninstalled it and wanted to return it but I was passed the return date which is my fault because I was ordering a bundle of things that I knew I would need for my kitchen renovation but did not get to the installation until it was after the date. Yes, my fault but nevertheless, it is disturbing since now I have paid for a low quality switch that I will likely never use. Be sure if you order this part that you check it thoroughly right away so you don't get stuck.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.title: Dimmer switch sticks in the left position.

reviews.productTitle: Maxxima LED Slide Dimmer Rocker Switch - 3-Way/Single Pole Compatible, Decorative Electrical Light Switch, 600 Watt Max, LED Compatible for Indoor Home Use, Wall Plate Cover Included - Ivory
reviews.text: This dimmer is awesome! It even fits next to a GFI outlet in a two gang box. More importantly, it dims my bulbs (both LED and originally Incandescent) smoothly down to nothing. There is a little low limit adjustment wheel before you put the plate back on that allows you to set the lowest level. In essence, a custom range. Also, I tested for Radio Frequency Interference. I put an AM radio right next to it to hear the buzzing, but 18” away it was clear. Perfect.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.title: Smooth dimming, no RFI, fits w/GFI

reviews.productTitle: Maxxima LED Slide Dimmer Rocker Switch - 3-Way/Single Pole Compatible, Decorative Electrical Light Switch, 600 Watt Max, LED Compatible for Indoor Home Use, Wall Plate Cover Included - Ivory
reviews.text: Purchased this Dimmer switch to work with GE LED BR30 Dimmerable 19Watt Flood Lights I have in my Kitchen. When you turn the slider to a dimmer position (perhaps 30 to 35% Brightness) ...next time you turn on lights they will not come on. You must slide the dimmer to a Higher setting. So if you want to be able to use a Constant brightness setting....be aware...at least with my Well Known GE LED BR30....this dimmer switch may not turn on lights...you will need to keep its brightness at a Higher setting. I did use the Adjusting wheel to set up the Switch with the Lights...that did not resolve the issue.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
reviews.title: Does not work with All Light Bulbs

After installing this switch our light fixture flickers randomly throughout the day; and yes, it is installed properly. We will be returning this one and purchase one from our local hardware store.

reviews.productTitle: Maxxima LED Slide Dimmer Rocker Switch - 3-Way/Single Pole Compatible, Decorative Electrical Light Switch, 600 Watt Max, LED Compatible for Indoor Home Use, Wall Plate Cover Included - Ivory
reviews.text: As an electrical worker with 50 + years in the trade the instructions were easy to understand. I don't recommend persons with NO electrical background to attempt to install this unit. First the instructions DO NOT cover all the different ways a 3-Way or a Single pole switch can be wired up. Example, older home single pole switches can have only one Black and one White wire in the box. In this case the white wire is used as a Hot (power) lead supplying power to the switch. In this case there is NO neutral wire in the box. 3-Way switches are even more complicated with travelers and multiple of ways to configure each switch not explained in the instructions. Each wire whether White, Black or Red must be identified, Power, Line, Load, Traveler or neutral before making your connections. As a reminder Most CFLs and many LED lights are NOT dimmable so check first.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2020
reviews.title: Not so simple

reviews.productTitle: Maxxima LED Slide Dimmer Rocker Switch - 3-Way/Single Pole Compatible, Decorative Electrical Light Switch, 600 Watt Max, LED Compatible for Indoor Home Use, Wall Plate Cover Included - Ivory
reviews.text: Ordered two of these dimmers and once installed to control my LED bulbs, both flicker. No amount of adjustment to the dimming wheel eliminates the flickering. Only position where I do not get flickering is full on position. Very disappointed after reading some stellar reviews. Would have returned but the "return window is closed". Made in CHINA. Re ordered Lutrons but they are in transit. Will report if the Lutrons prevent flicker. I have every reason to believe they will be flicker free because they are an established brand. Not recommended.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
reviews.title: Flicker

reviews.productTitle: Maxxima LED Slide Dimmer Rocker Switch - 3-Way/Single Pole Compatible, Decorative Electrical Light Switch, 600 Watt Max, LED Compatible for Indoor Home Use, Wall Plate Cover Included - Ivory
reviews.text: Brightness is not a good catagory for a dimmer switch. The better catagory would be variability. The leds they were hooked to only dim about 2/3 before shutting off. The 2nd adjustment helps some. The worst part is it causes the leds to buz in the 3k hertz down to 1k htz with the dim. Can lights are less effected than the led bulbs that screw in. Couldnt use dimmer on those even though they are dimmer rated.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
reviews.title: Looks good, not very led friendly or full dim

reviews.text: We had to replace our dimmer switch for our bathroom. This switch seemed sturdier than our previous one so was very happy until we tried dimming our light for night time use. Whenever we dimmed our light to where we wanted it the light would not turn on. You could verily dim the light for it to turn on and off at that exposure which defeated the purpose of having the dimmer in the first place because it was still too bright.
